title: How to Make Adana Kebab

steps.headline: Put the minced meat in a bowl.
steps.description: If you have half beef, half mutton then mix it a bit.

steps.headline: Cut the butter and the onion into small pieces and add them to the minced meat.
steps.description: Add also the coriander, cumin and biber.

steps.headline: Cut the sweet pepper into a few big chunks and use an immersion blender to puree the sweet pepper.
steps.description: If you have no immersion blender you can also cut the sweet pepper into very small pieces.

steps.headline: Add the puree to the minced meat.
Divide the minced meat into four equal sized, rectangle shaped kebabs.
steps.description: If you are using the long skewer, you may not need to divide the meat. You would make a long patty to put on the skewer, as shown.

tyn: Oven (with grill), electric indoor grill or barbecue
Immersion blender (you can also cut the sweet pepper in to very small pieces but an immersion blender is much easier).
text: Put the minced meat in a bowl. If you have half beef, half mutton then mix it a bit. Cut the butter and the onion into small pieces and add them to the minced meat. Add also the coriander, cumin and biber. Cut the sweet pepper into a few big chunks and use an immersion blender to puree the sweet pepper. If you have no immersion blender you can also cut the sweet pepper into very small pieces. Add the puree to the minced meat.  Add salt and pepper.  Knead the minced meat.  Divide the minced meat into four equal sized, rectangle shaped kebabs. If you are using the long skewer, you may not need to divide the meat. You would make a long patty to put on the skewer, as shown.
